availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: William J. Henry (Todd County, Kentucky, farmer and provisional government convention member)

body.p: Todd County, Kentucky, farmer and provisional government convention member. Tennessee native. Married Mary A. Newman Henry in Todd County, Kentucky, on September 1, 1849. Father of Samuel E. Henry and M.M. Henry. Farmer in Todd County in 1850. Owned one enslaved person in Todd County in 1850. Farmer in Todd County in 1860. Member of the convention of the provisional government held at Russellville in 1861.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Todd County, District 2, p. 250A.
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Todd County, District 2, p. 167.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Todd County, p. 807.
Kentucky Marriage Records, Madison County Courthouse, Richmond, Kentucky, Todd County Marriages, Film #000367186, p. 55.
KYR-0004-033-0001.
